programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.sub-title: Free Spirit : How Birmingham Bars Embrace Blue Collar Roots and a Multicultural Present
programme.desc: Birmingham’s favorite bartenders take Kate on a world tour of cocktails with tropical tiki showstoppers, aromatic Middle Eastern flavors, blue-collar dive bar favorites, and Kate’s first and truest love – agave spirits.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Fire up the grill and pour a cold one. Chefs Carleen King and Neil Blazin are facing off in a Summer Cookout cook-off. Can our chefs keep their cool? Or will they melt down in the summer heat?

programme.title: FIXT
programme.sub-title: FIXT: Mom With Traumatic Past Wants To Smile Again
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cia’s seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Grisly Discovery on the Gulf Coast
programme.desc: When body parts wash ashore in the Gulf Coast over several days in 2012, investigators must identify the victim before they can find the killers. Even then, justice is elusive.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.sub-title: Human Race By Runner’s World, Vol 3
programme.desc: Runner-in-Chief, Jeff Dengate, presents stories from around the country of runners using their sport for good.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The 15-Year Fight for Justice in a Small Town Teen’s Killing
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Miranda's Daring Dive for Growth
programme.desc: Miranda, a 24-year-old mechanical engineer was diagnosed with MS. Determined not to let MS dim her zest for life, Miranda and Kinga set out to find the outdoor fun in and around Cincinnati.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: The Marriage of Flavors
programme.desc: Big City Chef Hish Hassan from Chickadees in Boston takes on Small town Chef J. Huntington Chase of The Rabbit Hole in Worthington in an explosion of flavors and techniques. Who will prevail in this Urban vs Rural showdown?

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.sub-title: In Transit: Miss Peppermint and Sacramento
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Drag Race’s Peppermint and shares an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Sacramento.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Sacred Traditions and Wild Expeditions in Taos, NM
programme.desc: Venture into Taos, New Mexico! Engage with the sacred traditions and life lessons of the people of Taos Pueblo, experience life off-the-gridn and enjoy thrilling river rafting adventures on the Rio Grande.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Seasonal ingredients are the stars of any dish, and Chef Chris Barnum-Dann and Chef Brett Bohlmann prove it in this fully vegetarian episode. Will the judges fawn over their flavors, or will they miss the meat?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Kinga is in Manchester, NH, to meet Matt Krajcik, a 26-year-old curriculum developer who survived a trying childhood. Now he is looking to reconnect to the nature around him that provided respite when he was young.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From home brewing to their rise as one of the most awarded breweries in Greenville, Nicole and Brian Cendrowski’s story is one of trial by fire as they strive to forge a unique, community-driven brewery.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: A New Morning For The Dating Scene
programme.desc: Retired and recently widowed, Morning is moving into the next chapter of her life and finding ways to meet new people in Sacramento. She and her dates will learn about plants, cakes and music, and prove you’re never too old to put yourself out there.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Daring Escapes From Custody
programme.desc: A look at daring escapes from custody and the breakouts that take on many forms – yet always involve finding and exploiting the weakest parts of the system.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Oklahoma Girl Scout Murders
programme.desc: As Girl Scouts at Camp Scott settle into their tents one evening, eerie footsteps and distant cries haunt the campers throughout the night. The unsettling sounds turn out to be the echos one of the largest murder investigations in Oklahoma's history.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Electric Adventures in Albuquerque, NM
programme.desc: Explore Albuquerque's electric allure! Uncover secrets of a haunted brothel, step into hidden speakeasies, savor the spicy kick of green chile and lose yourself in epic views. Join us as we journey into the heart of New Mexico!

programme.title: Chronicle: Pittsburgh After Dark
programme.desc: (2024) In this episode of "Chronicle," we're going to look at the side of Pittsburgh you don't normally see: When the sun does down and the moon comes up.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Girls5eva’s Busy Philipps. Dave and Busy play Travels and Tribulations, and Dave shares his Esquire-approved itinerary for things to do in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: WTAE Chronicle
programme.desc: Looking back on a decade of Chronicles at WTAE and revisiting some of the most impactful stories we’ve told about Pittsburghers.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.sub-title: News 9 True Crime: The Middle Child
programme.desc: (2022) In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Chronicle: Quip Town
programme.desc: (2024) An all-access look at the Aliquippa high school football team's journey to repeat as state champions, from training camp through the season, all while battling numerous obstacles.

programme.title: Plate It Picklesburgh
programme.desc: Plate It Picklesburgh

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: White-Collar Crimes
programme.desc: These criminals may not have blood on their hands, but they still leave despair in their wake. From shady non-profits to fraudulent contractors, to wide-spread postal theft, here are some of the most devastating white-collar crimes to be attempted across the country.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Unexpected Eats with Midwest Flair
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Selfless Soul Receives Moments of Joy One Surprise at a Time
programme.desc: Kar is a selfless soul known for his unwavering commitment to the unhoused in his community. It's Kar's turn to have some good old-fashioned fun.
